dt: {bc}one of a series of positions or stations one above the other {bc}{sx|step||}
{bc}the height of the surface of a river above an arbitrary zero point
{bc}the part of a theater on which the acting takes place and which often includes the wings
{bc}the acting profession {bc}the theater as an occupation or activity
{bc}a center of attention or scene of action
{bc}the small platform of a microscope on which an object is placed for examination
{bc}a place of rest formerly provided for those traveling by {a_link|stagecoach} {bc}{sx|station||}
{bc}the distance between two stopping places on a road
{bc}a period or step in a process, activity, or development: such as
{bc}one of the distinguishable periods of growth and development of a plant or animal
{bc}a period or phase in the course of a disease
{bc}the degree of involvement or severity of a disease
{bc}an element or part of an electronic device (such as an amplifier)
{bc}one of two or more sections of a rocket that have their own fuel and engine

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}estage{/it} abode, story of a building, state, from Vulgar Latin {it}*staticum{/it}, from Latin {it}stare{/it} to stand {ma}{mat|stand|}{/ma}
shortdef: one of a series of positions or stations one above the other : step
the height of the surface of a river above an arbitrary zero point

dt: {bc}to produce (something, such as a play) on a stage
{bc}to produce or cause to happen for public view or public effect
{bc}to determine the phase or severity of (a disease) based on a classification of established symptomatic criteria
{bc}to evaluate (a patient) to determine the phase, severity, or progression of a disease

shortdef: to produce (something, such as a play) on a stage
to produce or cause to happen for public view or public effect

to determine the phase or severity of (a disease) based on a classification of established symptomatic criteria; also : to evaluate (a patient) to determine the phase, severity, or progression of a disease

dt: {bc}in a series of separate steps rather than all at one time

dt.t: The changes will be made {it}in stages{/it}.

shortdef: in a series of separate steps rather than all at one time

dt: {bc}the central part of a theatrical stage

dt.t: an issue that has taken {it}center stage{/it} in the campaign

shortdef: the central part of a theatrical stage
a central or highly prominent position

dt: {bc}a return to a former position or condition (as of success or prosperity) {bc}{sx|recovery||}, {sx|revival||}

dt.t: … staging his ultimate {wi}comeback{/wi} from self-imposed exile in Belgium.
These days, the cocktail—the true cocktail—is said to be {phrase}making a comeback{/phrase}.

shortdef: a sharp or witty reply : retort
a return to a former position or condition (as of success or prosperity) : recovery, revival

dt: {bc}the stage in the British legislative process preceding the third reading and concerned especially with amendments and details

shortdef: the stage in the British legislative process preceding the third reading and concerned especially with amendments and details

dt: {bc}a stage that projects beyond the proscenium so that the audience sits around the projection
{bc}a forestage that is extended into the auditorium to increase the stage area

shortdef: a stage that projects beyond the proscenium so that the audience sits around the projection; also : a forestage that is extended into the auditorium to increase the stage area
